fields.name: encoding format
fields.comment: Format to use when generating the tag

fields.name: compression level
fields.comment: This can be from 0.0 to 1.0. For Ogg Vorbis, higher levels meaning better quality but worse sizes (quality 0 to quality 10). For FLAC, this is the inverse: higher levels mean better sizes but longer compression times, and this is clamped to 0.0 to 0.8 (FLAC 0 to FLAC 8). Note that higher Ogg Vorbis levels will be worse than FLAC 8 in both size and quality.
